H0.text: Fluid is the medium whose macroscopic movement constitutes convection, the heat transfer by the macroscopic movement of a fluid.

H1.text: Gravity is the macroscopic movement by which convection transfers heat.

H2.text: Gases are the substances whose macroscopic movement constitutes convection, a heatâ€‘transfer mechanism.

H3.text: Tissue is the macroscopic substance whose movement constitutes convection, the heat transfer that occurs by the macroscopic movement of tissue.

A4.text: Convection is a process involving bulk movement of a fluid that usually leads to a net transfer of heat through advection.

A5.text: Convection may be due to gravitational body forces.
